headline: 2025-10-27 — ArXiv paper authors published a design that utilizes 1 simple RLC circuit as an illustrative controllable component to demonstrate the proposed interaction-variable based control for microgrids (evidence: “we utilize a simple RLC circuit”).

2025-10-28 — The same ArXiv paper's authors specified sufficient stability conditions for implementation via 2 control algorithms — Feedback Linearizing Control (FBLC) and Sliding Mode Control (SMC) — as the means to implement the reactive-power command (evidence: “implemented using either Feedback Linearizing Control (FBLC) or Sliding Mode Control (SMC), for which sufficient stability conditions are stated”).

2025-10-29 — The paper generalized the interaction variable to capture 2 system-wide quantities — instantaneous power and generalized reactive power — to set reference points for multi-layered distributed output feedback control (evidence: “The same variable captures aggregate system-wide effects ... instantaneous power and generalized reactive power”).

2025-10-30 — A correction note published on ArXiv corrects 1 pretty serious mistake in the 2007 paper by R. Olfati-Saber, J.A. Fax, and R.M. Murray (evidence: “This note corrects a pretty serious mistake ... published in Vol. 95 of the Proceedings of the IEEE (2007)”).
